partA.question: With all the good programs available it’s difficult to make a quick decision.
The search for qualified software engineer is truly difficult.
Roads through woods can be scary when there’s no light.
Somebody told me to speed up.
Bob and Tom talked all day.
These plates and glasses would make a fine present.

partB.question: Staying here/how long/are you?
partB.rearranged: How long are you staying here?

partB.question: Of your family/any pictures/do you have?
partB.rearranged: Do you have any pictures of your family?

partB.question: Of mine/he is/ a friend.
partB.rearranged: He is a friend of mine.

partB.question: Next door/is for sale/the house.
partB.rearranged: The house next door is for sale.

partD.question: You’re driving too ___. you should slow down.
I haven’t eaten anything all day. I’m so ___.
She was awarded a promotion based on her excellent ___ on the job.
It was so ___ outside that no one wanted to leave the air-conditioned house.

partE.question: I have to agree with you.
The company first opened when I was much younger.
It’s a good idea to create a different version of your resume.
You can use the computer in a minute.

partF.passage: John is the sales manager of a small store. An angry customer called him to complain about a home security system.
Sam was on a busy flight that had been delayed. The plane finally landed and arrived at the gate.
Mary won this year’s best teacher award at her university. She has been known for her creative and unique teaching style.
Employees who wish to take time off during the summer should check with their managers in advance.
